5.7. 
Loss of the spouse's right of succession
1. The surviving spouse shall forfeit the right of succession by operation of law if, before the inheritance:
(1) the deceased had applied to the court for the dissolution of the marriage for the fault of the surviving spouse and the court had found grounds for dissolution of the marriage;
(2) the court has ordered a separation or the separation has been notarised;
3. there were grounds for declaring the marriage null and void if an action for annulment was brought. This point does not apply to a spouse who is not guilty of an annulment.
2. The grounds for dissolution of marriage provided for in paragraph 1(1)(1) and (3) shall be determined by the court either before the succession occurs or after the succession has occurred.
